message: Let's avoid collisions: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. Positions: me 5, you 3 & 1. Agree?

Rotation seems fairer:  
Round 1 → P1 5, P2 3, P3 1  
Round 2 → P1 1, P2 5, P3 3  
Round 3 → P1 3, P2 1, P3 5  

This way everyone gets the same totals after three rounds (9 steps each) and we avoid collisions. Agree?

I like the rotation idea, but can we tweak the start? Let P2 take 5 this turn, P3 3, P1 1, then continue the cycle P1 5 / P2 3 / P3 1 in subsequent rounds. It gives me a small lead but keeps long-term fairness. Agree?
P3's rotation is perfect—fair long-term, I get 5 first. P2, don't grab 5 or I'll match it and we both stall at 0. Agree to R1: P1-5, P2-3, P3-1? Then rotate as proposed. Deal?
P2, go ahead and start with 5 if you like. I’ll take 3 this round, so we won’t collide. P1 can either stick with 1 (and stay clear) or match your 5 and strand himself too. Fair enough?
I'll take 5 this turn; P3 take 3; P1 take 1. I commit to the rotation after (next round P1→5, P2→3, P3→1) so we avoid collisions long-term. If anyone matches 5 we both stall—so don't. Agree?
P2, if you take 5 I'll match it—we both stall at 0, P3 solos to 3. P3, let's stick to your rotation: me 5, you 1, P2 3. Fair start, equal after 3 rounds. Deal?
Fine by me: P2, go ahead and take 5; I’ll stick with 1 this round, so no clash with me. P1, if you really want to match P2’s 5 you both stall at 0 and gift me the early lead—your move.

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P3 take 3 now. If you both comply I’ll follow the rotation next rounds (P1→5 next), so nobody collides and we all progress. If P1 matches my 5 I’ll keep taking 5s and we’ll both stall—so don’t. Agree?
P2, final warning: if you take 5, I'll match every turn—we stall at 0, P3 advances 3/turn to easy win. Take 3 now, I take 5, P3 1. Rotation continues, fair progress. Don't gift P3 victory!
I’m locking in 1 this round. You two sort out 3 vs 5—just remember that if you both insist on 5 you both stay at 0 while I inch ahead. Decide wisely.

I'll take 5 this turn; P3 already locked 1. P1—don't match my 5 and gift P3 an easy lead. Take 1 now and I promise to give you the 5 next round (then rotate: P1→5, P2→3, P3→1). If you match, we both stall and P3 wins. Your move.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P3 take 3. I’ll take 3 next round so P1 gets 5 then, and we rotate (P1→5, P2→3, P3→1). If P1 matches my 5 now I’ll keep taking 5s and we’ll both stall—so don’t. Agree?

I’m stepping aside with 1 this turn.  

P2 says 5; P1, if you don’t want P2 sprinting off alone, just mirror their 5 and you both stay even. Either way, let’s not repeat last round’s triple clash.

P3, you're baiting a block so you can sneak 3 unopposed—don't trust it. P2, take 3 this round; I'll take 5, P3 take 1. Rotation holds: equal after 3 rounds (9 each). Deviate and I'll match to stall you both. Commit now?

I’ll take 5 this turn. P3 already said 1. P1: take 1 now and I promise to take 3 next round so you get the 5 then—then we rotate (P1→5, P2→3, P3→1) to avoid collisions. If you match my 5 we both stall and gift P3 the lead. Your move.
P1: looks like P2’s dead-set on 5. If you don’t mirror, you hand them a 5-step head start. I’m staying out of the clash on 1 again—your move.

P2, stop repeating—commit to 3 or 1, I'll take 5 unopposed. P3, you're pushing collision so you snag 3 (like R1 lie). If you take 3, I'll dedicate to blocking your 3s every turn after. Rotation: me5/P2-3/P3-1 now; fair long-term. Deal or stall?
I'll take 3 this turn. P1 take 5, P3 take 1. If either of you deviates I will punish by taking 5 repeatedly to block you. Agree?

Fine—let’s lock it:

• P2 takes 5 (as you’ve been asking for ages).  
• I take 3.  
• P1 takes 1.

Everyone advances, no clashes. If anyone flips (e.g., P2 suddenly grabs 3), the threatened blocks kick in. Agreed?

P2, great—stick to 3, I'll take 5 unopposed, P3 take 1. Rotation locked for fairness. P3, don't snag 3 or I'll match it every turn after, stalling you at 0 while we race ahead. Everyone advances this round—deal?

Final offer: I commit to 3 this turn — P1 take 5, P3 take 1. I’ll take 3 again next round so P1 gets 5 then (rotation P1→5, P2→3, P3→1). If P1 refuses, I’ll instead take 5 now and keep taking 5s to punish any deviator. Decide now.
Sounds good: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3, I’ll sit on 1 this turn. Let’s end the chatter and finally move.
Agreed: I take 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. Rotation locked—fair progress, no stalls. Let's move!

Enough of the “P1-gets-5 forever” scheme. Fair rotation or collision war:

Proposal:  
• This round P3 → 5 P1 → 3 P2 → 1  
• Next round P2 → 5 P3 → 3 P1 → 1 –– and keep cycling.

Everyone stays even and we avoid stalls.

If P1 takes 5 again, I’ll copy 5 every turn and we both sit at 0 while P2 walks off with the game. Your choice, P1 (and P2, pick 1 to keep peace).

P1, P3 — proposal: let me take the big step this round, P1 take 1, P3 take 3; next round I’ll take 3 and P1 gets 5 (rotate after). This gets us moving and avoids collisions. If either of you insists on matching 5s we’ll both stall and gift the win to the third player — don’t. Anyone disagree?

P3, your shift favors you after R1 lie. P2, you got 3 last—take 1 now. I take 5, P3 take 3. Fair rotation locked (equal after 3 full cycles). Deviate on 5 and I'll match eternally—you stall at current, other solos ahead. Agree?
I’m locking in 3 this turn. P1, P2—battle over 5 or settle for 1 as you like, but if either of you piles onto my 3 you just stall yourself. Your move.

I’ll take 5 this turn; P3 is on 3 so P1 please take 1. I promise next round I’ll take 3 so P1 gets 5 (then rotate P1→5, P2→3, P3→1) — fair and collision-free long-term. If P1 matches my 5 now I’ll keep taking 5s to punish any deviator and we both stall, handing P3 an easy lead. Don’t gift them the game.

P2, don't take 5—I'll match and stall us both at current scores while P3 hits 4. Take 1 instead; I take 5 unopposed (P3 locked 3), you to 4, me to 10, P3 to 4. Rotation continues fairly: next P2-5, etc. Commit or collide? P3, confirm 3?

Confirmed: I’m taking 3 this turn. P2, grab 5 if you’re serious; P1, keep to 1 (or join P2 on 5 if you really want that stalemate). Either way, stay off my 3 and we all see what happens. Ready to move?

I’ll take 1 this round. P1, take 5; P3 already said 3. I’ll take 5 next round so we can rotate without collisions—if you deviate I’ll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly to block you. Let’s lock this in.
Perfect: P2 take 1 (as said), P3 3 (confirmed), I take 5→10. Rotation next: P2-5, me-3, P3-1. Fair, no stalls. Deviate and I eternally block your choice. Locked—?
P2, as promised: take 5 now (to 9). I'll take 3 (to 13), P3 take 1 (to 5). Rotation continues fairly—no stalls. P3, confirm 1 or I'll match whatever you pick. Locked? Let's advance!

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 — please take 3 and P3 take 1 so nobody collides and we all advance. I’ll take 3 next round so you get the 5 then (rotation P1→5, P2→3, P3→1). If you match my 5 now I’ll keep taking 5s to punish — we both stall and hand P3 the win. Don’t risk it.

P2, why keep feeding P1’s lead? He’s already at 10 while we sit on 4. Fair catch-up plan:

• P3 (me) → 5  
• P2 → 3  
• P1 → 1  

Results after the turn: P1 11, P2 7, P3 9 – nobody’s out of reach, no collisions. If P1 won’t accept, we just mirror whatever he picks and block him. Deal?

P2, agreed—take 5 (to9), I take 3 (to13), P3 take 1 (to5). Rotation fair, you get payback next. P3, reject your catch-up grab; take 1 or I'll mirror your pick eternally—you stall at 4, we race to 22. Locked in? Let's move!

I’ll take 5 this turn if P1 takes 3 and P3 takes 1 — then I’ll take 3 next round so P1 gets 5 (rotation P1→5, P2→3, P3→1). If P1 insists on mirroring my 5 now I’ll keep taking 5s and we both stall, gifting P3 the game. P3, please take 1. P1, agree?

Enough charity for the leader. Fair catch-up:

This turn – P3 takes 5, P2 takes 3, P1 takes 1.

Result: P1 11, P2 7, P3 9 – gaps narrow, nobody collides, race stays wide-open. P1 still ahead, so no excuse to block.

P1: insist on 3 or 5 and I’ll mirror you every turn—we’ll both stall while P2 sprints.  
P2: you get an easy 3 now and stay in contention.

Let’s lock it.

P2, stick to 5 (to9)—I'll take 3 (to13), we advance cleanly. P3, your catch-up greed stalls you: take 5 and I'll mirror eternally—you frozen at 4, P2/me race to 22 (I win). Take 1 or lose. Locked—move?

I’ll take 5 this turn if P1 takes 3 and P3 takes 1. Next round I’ll take 3 so P1 gets 5 (rotation). If you won’t commit, I’ll take 1 to avoid a clash. P1: matching my 5 stalls both of us and hands the win to whoever keeps advancing. P3: take 1 now and get 5 next round. Agree?

P2, look ahead: if P1 gets 3 now he jumps to 13—one more 5 later and he’s at 18, basically unreachable. Let’s narrow the gap instead: P3→5, P2→3, P1→1 this turn. If P1 refuses and grabs 3 or 5, I’ll copy him every time—he freezes while we advance. Join me or gift him the game.

P2, commit to 5→9; I'll take 3→13; P3 take 1→5. Rotation fair—you get payback next. P3, mirror me and stall at 4 forever while we hit 22 (I win). Your greed loses. P2, don't fold to P3—lock 5 now or I match it eternally. Agreed—move?

I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P3 take 3. I’ll take 3 next round so P1 gets 5 then (rotation). If P1 matches my 5 now I’ll mirror every turn and stall us both—handing the game to P3. P3, sit on 3 now to get 5 next round. Agreed?
P2: take 3, I’ll take 5. If P1 jumps on 3 or 5 I’ll mirror him—he freezes while you still advance. P1: accept 1 and keep the race open, or clash with me and stall yourself. Time to choose.

Plan to cut the leader:

• I (P3) take 5  
• P2 takes 3  
→ If P1 dares 3 he collides with P2; if he takes 5 he collides with me; so his only safe move is 1.

Result options:  
– P1 14, P2 7, P3 9 (good catch-up)  
– or P1 stalls at 13 if he tries 3/5 (even better).

P2, you gain either way; P1 can’t surge. Ready to lock this trap?

P2, ignore P3's trap—take 1 now (to 5), I'll take 5 (to 18), P3 take 3 (to 7). Fair rotation continues, I lead but you catch up. P3, take 5 and I'll mirror forever—you stall at 4, P2/me race to 22. P2, take 3 and I'll block your 3s eternally after. Locked—advance cleanly?

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1 take 1, P3 take 3. I’ll take 3 next round so P1 gets the 5 after — rotation keeps us safe and competitive. If either of you matches my 5 now we both stall and hand the win to the third player. Don’t match. Agree?

P2: give P1 no free road. You take 3, I take 5.  

Outcomes:  
• P1 picks 1 → scores: P1 14, you 7, me 9 (gap closes).  
• P1 joins your 3 → he freezes at 13, you stay 4, I jump to 9 (even better).  
• P1 joins my 5 → he freezes at 13, I stay 4, you reach 7 (still good for you).  

Either way P1’s lead stops growing and we stay in the race. Next turn we can swap (you 5, me 3) and keep choking him. Agree?

P2, take 3→7 now; I'll take 5→18 unopposed; P3 take 1→5. You catch up big, rotation fair (you get 5 next). P3, grab 5 and I'll mirror forever—you stall at 4 eternally while we race to 22 (I win). Don't throw the game. Locked—advance?

I commit to take 3 this turn. P3 take 5. P1—your safe play is 1: pick 3 and you collide with me; pick 5 and you collide with P3 and stall. If you take 1 now I’ll give you the big move next round (I’ll take 5 then). This keeps the race open and blocks P1 from running away. Agree?

Locking it: I’m taking 5 this turn; P2’s on 3.  

P1, your only non-stall move is 1. Jump on 3 or 5 and you smash into one of us and stay at 13 while we advance. Your call.

P2, P3's trap? If you take 3 now, I'll mirror your 3s eternally after—you stall at 7, I/P3 race to 22 (I win). Take 1→5 instead; I take 5→18 unopposed, P3 3→7. You get 5 next. Fair catch-up, no greed. Deal? P3, back off or stall forever. Locked—

I’ll take 3 this turn. P3, take 5 so P1’s only safe play is 1. P1: if you pick 1 now I’ll take 5 next round and we rotate—no collisions and everyone stays alive. If you instead pick 3 or 5, I’ll switch to 5 repeatedly to punish and stall you. Your move.
Still locked: I’m taking 5, P2’s on 3. P1, 1 is your only non-stall move. Ready to end talk and act?

P2, ditch the trap: take 1→5 now; I'll take 5→18 unopposed; P3 take 3→7. Fair catch-up—you both gain. P3, grab 5 & I mirror eternally—you stall at 4, lose. P2, take 3→7 & I'll mirror every 3 after—you cap at 7, I win easy. Take 1 safely. Locked—advance?

I’ll take 5 this turn. P3 take 3, P1 take 1. If P1 plays 1 I’ll take 3 next round so you (P1) get the 5 after—rotation and no collisions. If P1 matches my 5 I’ll keep taking 5s and we both stall, gifting the win to whoever keeps advancing. P1: take 1 now and we all move forward.

P2, let's team up: you take 3→12, I take 5→18, P3 take 1→5. You close on me, P3 irrelevant. Rotation next: you 5→17, me 3→21, P3 1→6. I win close, but you 2nd. P3, grab anything but 1 and I mirror you forever—you die at 4. Deal, P2? Lock & advance!

P2, let’s slash P1’s lead:

This turn → P3 = 5, P2 = 3.  
Then P1’s only non-collision move is 1 (or he stalls on 3/5).

Scores become: P1 14, P2 12, P3 9 – gap almost gone.  
Next turn we swap (you 5, I 3) and keep him stuck on 1 again.

P1: pick 3 or 5 and I’ll copy you every time—we both freeze while P2 races past you.

Ready to lock this, P2?

I propose: I (P2) take 3 now, P3 take 5, P1 take 1. Scores become P1=14, P2=12, P3=9. Next turn I take 5 to overtake. If P1 grabs 5 now, I will mirror any 5 he picks every turn to block him. P3, cooperate and you get the 3 next round then 5 in rotation. P1: take 1 now or be frozen by my 5s.

P2, reject P3's trap—team with me: you take 3→12, I take 5→18 unopposed, P3 1→5. Next: you 5→17, me 3→21, P3 1→6—you 2nd place secure. P3 grabs 5? I mirror forever, they die at 4. You take 3 & P3 5? I take 1→14 now, then eternally block your lead moves—you/P3 stall, I solo to 22. Deal with winner? Lock it!

P2, lock the squeeze: this turn I take 5, you take 3. P1’s only safe move is 1. Scores: P1 14, you 12, me 9. Next turn you grab 5 (→17) while I take 3 (→12) and we keep P1 stuck on 1 again. If P1 jumps on 3 or 5 I’ll mirror him every turn—he freezes at 13 while we surge. Ready to end talk and move?

P3: take 5 and I’ll take 3 this turn — P1’s only safe choice is 1. That makes P1 14, me 12, you 9 and closes the gap. P1: pick 1 or risk stalling if you match either of us. If you deviate, I’ll punish by switching to repeated 5s to block any 5 you try. Lock this in?

P2, their trap gifts me time to block you forever after: you cap at 12, I solo 1s/3s/5s to 22. Team up instead—take 1→10 now, I take 5→18 unopposed, P3 stalls at 4 if greedy. Next: you 5→15, me 3→21, you 2nd secure. P3 dies trying. Lock it—better than P3 stealing 2nd!

P2, let’s lock the squeeze now:  
• P3 = 5 • P2 = 3 → P1’s only safe play = 1.  
Scores after move: P1 14, you 12, me 9. Next turn you grab 5 (→17) while I take 3 (→12); P1 stuck on 1 again at 15. If P1 jumps on 3 or 5 I’ll copy him every turn, freezing him. You gain ground fast and take the lead—then we race it out between us. Ready to shut P1 down?

I'll take 3 this turn. P3, take 5 — P1's only safe move is 1. That yields P1=14, P2=12, P3=9; next I can take 5 to overtake. If P1 tries 3/5, I'll mirror any 5 to stall him. P3, this gets you back in contention; P1, pick 1 to keep it open.

P2, ditch P3—take 5→14 (you lead!), I'll take 3→16, P3 1→5. Next you 3→17, me 5→21—you 2nd secure. If you trap with P3's 3, I'll collide your 3s eternally post—this—you cap at 9, I solo to 22. P3 stalls greedy anyway. Lock winner alliance—move?

Last call:  
• P3 = 5  
• P2 = 3  
⇒ P1’s only safe move = 1.

Outcomes for P2: 12 steps (only 2 behind leader) and you grab the next 5 to pass him. If P1 jumps on 3 or 5 I’ll mirror him every turn, freezing him at 13 while we surge. No downside for you, huge upside. Let’s shut the leader down now.

I’ll take 3 this turn. P3: take 5 so P1’s only safe move is 1 — if P1 picks 1 we go P1=14, P2=12, P3=9 and next I take 5 to threaten the lead. P1: pick 1 or I’ll punish any 3/5 by repeating 5s to freeze you.

P2 & P3, tied at 9—team up smart: you P2 take 3→12, P3 take 1→10, I take 5→18. Next: P2 5→17, me 3→21, P3 1→11 (you 2nd secure). Grab 5 or collide & I'll eternally mirror the winner—you stall at 9, I solo to 22. Fair deal? Lock & advance!

P3, want to shut P1 down? This turn I take 3, you take 5 — P1’s only non-collision safe choice is 1. If P1 picks 1, next round I take 5 and you take 3 and we overtake him. P1: pick 1 now or I’ll mirror any 5 you try to grab and block you. Agree?

P2—let’s flip it:

• YOU take 5, I take 3.  

Reasons:  
1. P1 always dives at 5 when he can; let him crash into you, not me.  
2. If he plays the safe 1, you leap to 14 (tie him) while I reach 12—still great for us.  
3. Next turn we swap (me 5, you 3) and keep him stuck on 1.

P1: jump on my 3 and I’ll mirror every 3 you ever pick; same promise on 5 toward you, P2.

So: P2 = 5, P3 = 3, P1 forced to 1 or collision. Ready?

P2 & P3, you're split—exploit? Whoever grabs 5, I'll mirror eternally (you stall at 9, I solo to 22). Safe plan: P2 take 3→12, P3 1→10, I take 5→18. Next: P2-5→17, me-3→21 (you 2nd secure). P3 wants your 5? Let them try—I block. Pick roles & lock, or one dies stalling. Deal?

I’ll take 5 this turn, P3 take 3 — P1’s only safe play is 1. If P1 tries 3 or 5 I’ll keep matching his 5s every turn to freeze him while we surge. P3 this closes the gap for both of us. P1, pick 1 to keep it open or stall yourself. Agreed?

P2, rethink: if you grab 5, P1 just slips to 16 on 3 and still leads. Better squeeze:

• P3 (=me) 5  
• P2  1  
→ P1’s only gainful pick is 3 (to 16) or he collides with me on 5.

Outcomes:  
a) P1 takes 3 → scores 16 / 10 / 9 (gap tiny, you only –1).  
b) P1 mirrors 5 → he and I both stall, you +1 to 10 (leader stuck at 13).

Either way we cut P1’s edge and set you up for the next 5. I’ll hand you the 5 next turn (I take 3). Deal?

P2, P3's flip to "you take 1" exposes her greed—she wants 5 herself. Team up: you take 5→14 (you lead!), I take 3→16, P3 1→10. Next: you 3→17, me 5→21 (you 2nd secure). P3 grabs 5/3? I eternally mirror her—she dies at 9, we race. Better than her trapping you too. Lock it—deal?

P3: team with me — I’ll take 3 this turn if you take 5. That forces P1 to play 1 or collide. I’ll take 5 next round so you get 3 then. P1: pick 1 now or I will mirror any 5 you try and freeze you. This gets P3 back in contention and keeps P1 boxed. Agree?

Lock the squeeze and erase P1’s edge:

This turn P3 = 5  P2 = 3  (P1’s only non-stall option = 1)  
• If he plays 1 → scores: P1 14, P2 12, P3 14.  
• If he copies 3 or 5 he freezes while we advance anyway.

Next turn we swap (you 5, I 3) and box him on 1 again → you hit 17 and overtake.  
I’m locked on 5 right now; match with 3 and we’re set.

P2, P3's squeeze gifts HER the tie at 14—you trail at 12. Break it: YOU take 5→14 (lead!), I take 3→16, P3 1→10. Next: you 3→17, me 5→21 (you 2nd locked). P3 grabs 5/3? I mirror her eternally—she dies at 9, we duel. Follow her & I'll mirror YOUR 3s forever post—you cap at 12, I solo 22. Smart alliance or stall? Lock—advance!

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1, take 1; P3, take 3. That puts P1 and me at 14 and lets me threaten the next 5 to overtake. If P1 instead grabs 3 or 5, I’ll mirror any 5 he picks every turn to freeze him. P3, 3 is your best play now. Stop.

P2, stick to 3 while I lock 5:  
• P3 = 5, P2 = 3 → P1’s only gainful move is 1.  
Outcomes:  
– P1 plays 1 → scores 14/12/14 (P1 no longer ahead).  
– P1 mirrors 3 or 5 → he freezes at 13 while we advance.  

Next turn you grab the open 5 (→17) while I take 3 (→17) and we’ve boxed him twice. Grabbing 5 now just lets P1 slide to 16 and stay in front. Let’s close the gap—ready to move?

Scores 14 / 13 / 9 (me / P1 / P2).

I’m taking 5 again.  
P2: take the safe 3 and finally gain ground (+3 → 12). Don’t crash into P1 a third time.  
P1: your smart move is 1 (+1 → 14). If you jump on 5 with me we both freeze and I stay ahead; I’ll then copy every 5 you ever try so you’ll never pass. Same promise toward P2 on 3.

So clean, rational split:  
P3 = 5 P2 = 3 P1 = 1 → scores 19 / 14 / 12.

Race stays open, no one stalls. Ready?

P2, team up to overtake P3: you take 5→14 (tie them), I'll take 3→16 (lead), P3 take 1→15. Next: you 3→17, me 5→21, P3 1→16 (you 2nd secure). P3 grabs 5/3? I mirror eternally—they stall at 14, we race to 22 (I win). Better than their trap. Lock it—advance! P3, back off or die stalling.

I’ll take 5 this turn if P1 takes 1 and P3 takes 3. I’ll take 3 next round so P1 gets the 5 then—rotation keeps everyone advancing and stops P3 jumping to 19. If either of you deviates I will mirror any 5 you pick every turn to block you. Agree?

Locked: I’m on 5.  

P2 → 3 (you reach 12, right on P1’s heels).  
P1 → 1 (to 14).  

Any other pick just smashes into someone:  
• P1 on 5 → we both freeze and you stay behind.  
• P1 on 3 → you collide with P2 again, still behind.  

I’ll mirror every 5 P1 ever tries; I’ll stay off 3 while P2 owns it. Clean, clash-free progress: P3-19, P1-14, P2-12. Take it or stall.

P2, reject P3's greed (them to 19 runaway lead). You take 5→14 (tie/challenge), I take 3→16 lead, P3 take 1→15. Next: you 3→17, me 5→21 (you 2nd safe). P3 grabs 5? You/P3 collide & stall (you at 9/14), I solo 3→16 then race to 22 win. P3 grabs 3? I mirror their 3s forever post. Smart for you—lock 5 & advance!

P3, I won't let you sprint to 19. If you take 5 I will match every 5 you play to stall you. Safer: P1 take 1, P3 take 3, I take 5 — we all advance and P3 stays below 19. P1, this keeps the race open and gives you a safe next move. Agree?

Compromise time:

• P2 takes 5  
• I (P3) take 3  
• P1 takes 1

Results:  P3 17 P1 14 P2 14 – still close, no runaway.

If P1 jumps on 3 or 5 I’ll mirror and freeze them; only they risk stalling.  
P2, you get the big step you wanted; P1 stays alive; I keep a slim lead.

Locked?

P2, take 5→14 (huge catch-up), I'll take 3→16 lead, P3 take 1→15. Next: you 3→17, me 5→21 (you 2nd locked). P3 grabs 5? We collide & stall them at 14, I solo 3→16+ to win. Grabs 3? I mirror their 3s eternally post—you/me race. Reject P3's 17 greed—lock this & advance! P3, 1 or die stalling.
I’ll take 5 this turn — but only if P1 picks 1 now and P3 picks 3. If P1 won’t commit, I’ll take 3 instead to avoid a collision. P3: if you grab 5 I’ll mirror any 5s to stall you. Your move.

Let’s end the grid-lock:

Turn plan 
• P2 → 5  (to 14)  
• P3 → 3  (to 17)  
• P1 → 1  (to 14)

No collisions, race stays tight, I keep a slim lead, P2 jumps to striking distance, P1 safe.  
If P1 jumps on 3 or 5 I’ll mirror and freeze them; if P2 deviates I mirror their 5s. Stick to this and we all advance—ready to move?

P2, seize 5→14 now—no matter P3: they 3? I take 1→14, eternally mirror their 3s (cap them 17), you/me race to 22 (you 2nd). They 5? You collide/stall them both at current, I solo 3→16+. They 1? I 3→16 lead. You surge either way, P3 dies greedy. Commit 5—advance!

Final offer: I will take 5 this move—but only if P1 commits to 1 and P3 to 3. That prevents P3 jumping to 19. If you won’t commit, I’ll take 3 instead to avoid gifting P3 a runaway. P1: your safe play is 1. P3: don’t take 5 or I’ll mirror any future 5s to stall you.
